alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Jones (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 10:24AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Jasper and northern Jones Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1024 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Soso, or 7 miles northwest of Laurel, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Moss around 1030 AM CDT. Sandersville around 1050 AM CDT. Mill Creek around 1105 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for east central Mississippi. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until noon CDT for southeastern Mississippi.
